security: Revealing operational details about AMLASH, AMTRUNK, and their contacts could compromise these operations. Specifically, the cable discusses efforts to locate AMLASH-9 and instructs AMTRUNK-10 not to contact certain individuals who may be associated with the Cuban regime or DGI. Disclosing these contacts and methods could expose ongoing intelligence activities and endanger individuals involved: “PLS ASK AMLASH-1 TELL AMTRUNK-10 NOT TRY LOCATE A-9 VIA ANY OF FOLLOWING WEOM A-10 MAY KNOW...”.
summary: A cable discussing concerns about the possible capture of AMTRUNK-9 in Cuba and instructs on how to proceed with locating AMLASH-9 without alerting Cuban authorities.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret cable, dated 4 February 1965, addresses concerns regarding the potential capture of AMTRUNK-9 in the Cardenas-Matanzas area of Cuba. It instructs JMWAVE and PARIS to reassure Mrs. A-9 (likely the wife of AMLASH-9) by showing her a Miami Herald article about a separate landing attempt. The cable advises WAVE to discourage Mrs. A-9 from seeking information via GPIDEAL or the Mexican President until AMLASH-1 can locate A-9 through AMTRUNK-10 after his return to Cuba on February 10. Additionally, PARIS is instructed to advise AMLASH-1 to tell AMTRUNK-10 to avoid contacting specific individuals in Cardenas and Havana who might be compromised or associated with the Cuban regime.
title: Regarding AMLASH and AMTRUNK Operations
